content: ganja jar jacket by sarah whitson this is the pattern i used for a specific jar i had from a rec 420 purchase it can be adapted to any jar regardless of its purpose however the number of row and stitches will vary based on your jar diameter and height as well as the hook size and yarn type used… the jar pictures was 2 1/8 in diameter and 2 1/2 in from bottom of jar to bottom of jar lid and i used worsted ish weight acrylic yarn with a 4 00mm g hook i also used a stitch/round marker for the continuous rounds a tapestry needle is also needed for weaving in loose ends part 1 this is worked in a round beginning with a magic_ring and crocheting 6 single_crochet with even increases of 6 in each new round this particular jar needed 7 rounds for the bottom but yours might require more or less so long as you increase evenly you can make any size you wish jar bottom round 1 mc 6sc pull tail tightly to close circle slip_stitch to 1st single_crochet of round 6sc round 2 ch1 single_crochet in 1st st 2sc into in each remaining stitch slip_stitch to 1st single_crochet of round 12sc round 3 ch1 single_crochet increase in every other st slip_stitch to 1st single_crochet of round 18sc round 4 ch1 single_crochet increase in every 3rd st slip_stitch to 1st single_crochet of round 24sc round 5 ch1 single_crochet increase in every 4th st slip_stitch to 1st single_crochet of round 30sc round 6 ch1 single_crochet increase in every 5th st slip_stitch to 1st single_crochet of round 36sc round 7 ch1 single_crochet increase in every 6th st slip_stitch to 1st single_crochet of round 42sc part 2 is continued on page 2… part 2 this is worked in the round as well however no increases will be created and the 1st round will be worked in back loops only this helps form the distinction between the bottom and sides of the jacket this particular jar needed 14 rounds for the sides but yours might require more or less you will continue to work in the round from 2 on without slip stitching until you have the height you require jar sides round 1 blo single_crochet in ea st around 42sc round 2 single_crochet in ea st around until desired height is met 42sc/round my jar needed 14 rounds of 42sc/round note double check the jar fit after you have completed a few rounds continue to check as you go to gauge the correct height needed fasten_off weave in loose ends
